docs.snippet: Bent Larsen of Denmark, victor in his first six games, drew in forty moves with Julio Sumar of Peru in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report received through Argentine news sources. The Peruvian player...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bent Larsen of Denmark, victor in his first six games, drew in forty moves with Julio Sumar of Peru in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report received through Argentine news sources. The Peruvian player had the black side of a queen's gambit declined.

headline.main: LARSEN LAYS DRAW IN GAME WITH SUMAR

docs.snippet: Mikhail Botvinnik, with a two-pawn advantage when the sixth game of his match with Vassily Smyslov for the world chess championship was adjourned Thursday, went on to triumph yesterday in Moscow. The game lasted 49 moves, according to reports from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mikhail Botvinnik, with a two-pawn advantage when the sixth game of his match with Vassily Smyslov for the world chess championship was adjourned Thursday, went on to triumph yesterday in Moscow. The game lasted 49 moves, according to reports from Soviet news sources.

headline.main: BOTVINNIK VICTOR IN SIXTH CONTEST; Beats Smyslov in 49 Moves and Leads World Title Chess Series, 4 1/2-1 1/2
DROBNY, KNIGHT GAIN; Reach Final in Cannes Singles -- Miss Butler Pair Scores

docs.snippet: BRIDGE news, in the nature of things, is usually concerned with duplicate bridge, the only form of the game played in tournaments. This has been especially true in the past few months, with a national tournament last December, a world-championship...
docs.lead_paragraph: BRIDGE news, in the nature of things, is usually concerned with duplicate bridge, the only form of the game played in tournaments. This has been especially true in the past few months, with a national tournament last December, a world-championship match in Italy in January, an international round-robin in South America in February, and now another national tournament this month, the one currently being played at Atlantic City.

docs.snippet: Two rounds, the ninth and tenth, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, were played over the week-end, according to reports received yesterday through Argentine news sources.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two rounds, the ninth and tenth, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, were played over the week-end, according to reports received yesterday through Argentine news sources.

headline.main: SLAYING FOLLOWS DUEL; Match Halted, Contestant Kills Foe and Himself

docs.snippet: HARTFORD, March 29 -- Two administrative assistants to the late Senator Brien McMahon appealed to Connecticut Democratic leaders this week to support William Benton for the party's Senate nomination.
docs.lead_paragraph: HARTFORD, March 29 -- Two administrative assistants to the late Senator Brien McMahon appealed to Connecticut Democratic leaders this week to support William Benton for the party's Senate nomination.
docs.abstract: E Roddan, J D Lane urge Dems to back Benton
